channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken Kerb, 14th June
item.description:
This has been reported as being fixed and you sent me an email this morning. Well it’s not and we still cannot park or get people to park outside for fear of damage to there tyres. Bexley Council should have done this by now. I will if no action is taken send all the evidence I have to the local MP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Longmeadow Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of dumped rubbish, 14th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 253, Beckenham Road, Penge, London

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish dumped on the pavement of Nuxley Road Belvedere DA17, 14th June
item.description:
A large quantity of rubbish, including food waste in black plastic sacks has been dumped on the pavement outside of the business premises at 49a - 53 Nuxley Road Belvedere DA17. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapley Road, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: Dead fox found in our back garden, 14th June
item.description:
We've found a dead fox cub in our back garden this morning. We will put it into a black bag and leave it outside the communal bin area in our Square along with a note for collection.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Rangers Square, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 14th June
item.description:
Litter on Tabard street including McDonald's packaging has not been removed despite fixmystreet stating it was picked up. Can the litter be removed around the rental bikes and on the pavement and road at the located.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Tabard Street, The Borough, London

item.title: In front of 13 Hampstead lane, 14th June
item.description:
There is a very deep and hard to see pothole on Hampstead lane. I almost hit it in my bicycle with my child on the back while coasting down the hill. It is very dangerous as it is deep enough to damage a tyre. If you aren’t able to repair it, could you send someone out to mark the location with yellow paint to make it more visible?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Hampstead Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foliage obstructing public footpath, 14th June
item.description:
Large bush has been left to grow out of control, obstructing the footpath and you have to go into the road to be able to get past. This presents a danger to pedestrians and happens every year. No consideration from household that this presents a risk to everyone wanting to use footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolbrook Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
